title: Manchester City goalkeeper Ederson believes champions are suffering without Aymeric Laporte
text:
Manchester City goalkeeper Ederson believes his side are suffering with Aymeric Laporte out injured.

The dominant central defender was a mainstay in the side under Pep Guardiola but will be out until the New Year with a cruciate ligament injury suffered against Brighton.

Manchester City have missed the defender and again looked shaky at the back as they lost 2-0 to Wolves at the weekend.

Ederson thinks the absence of Aymeric Laporte has hurt Manchester City this season

Ederson said: 'It's very difficult for a team like us having injuries, especially if they all happen in the same position on the pitch.

'We all know about the amazing quality of Aymeric and how good he is in the build-up phase. Of course we are missing him.

'We have other great players who can replace him in that position.

'Unfortunately, with the injury to John Stones, we have only one natural centre-back.

The defender will be out of action until the New Year after suffering a knee injury

'I think the team needs to be mentally strong to carry on playing and winning in the championship.'

Liverpool have stolen a march on the champions and are currently eight points clear at the summit after eight games.

John Stones is expected back for City on October 19 and his return will be a huge plus for Guardiola as his side look to cut the deficit.
description: Manchester City goalkeeper Ederson believes his side are suffering with Aymeric Laporte out injured. The defender's absence has been keenly felt.
